Add to it a biopic on one of the pioneers from the airline industry it's a perfect 10.. ofcourse there is a lot of dramatization on the personal aspects but I think the corporate parts are likely and absolutely close to the truth. What makes the movie a watchable entertainer is how they have combined the two. Well directed Sudha. Great to see Aparna pull off her role with elan. And GV is back. The score is difficult for such movies but he is very good.

He is a Tamilian, not being state biased but we saw him as we know him by heart & Paresh Rawal (Babu Bhaiya) is Love, he always bring something new to his character and always perform overstanding. Thanks Amazon Prime Video for bring such an excellent movie.

This is a film about a man who has dreams larger than himself. Soorarai pottru doesn't wastes time as it directly entice us into the plot from the word go. One might feel the movie to be bit draggy. Its a biopic and it stands true to its genre and we cant expect a biopic to be fast paced when a man is suffering for his dreams.Coming to the technical aspects , everyone makes us awestruck. Special mention to the cinematography and art direction. Suriya once again proves why he is a celebrated actor and you can see only MAARA on screen. Aparna has done an marvelous job and she shines as BOMMI. Kudos to the director who has written such a strong female character to whom her husband asks money for his business. Kaali Venkat and Oorvashi has a meaty roles and they did justice to their character.After a long time G. V. Prakash hits us with something unique and fresh. Every track has come out very well and it was exceptionally picturised. B. G. M from the music director could have been even better.Sudha kongara who wants herself to be addressed as a director and not a "female" director is nothing short of any contemporary male directors. But I have an issue here. To make a biopic, you have to be 💯 perfect. Showing G. R. Gopinath( real maara) differently from what he is breaking down the authenticity of this biopic. Apart from that the Director stands tall. Special mention to Vijayakumar who penned the dialogues. The dialogues were so intense as it helps to verbalise the feelings of every character of the film.So put it all together, Soorarai pottru hits the Bullseye.

Soorarai pottru truly deserves all the praise coming its way. This movie has definitely raised the standard of tamil cinema. Right from the beginning I was hooked, and I couldn't take my eyes off the screen.From the casting, the direction, the cinematography, the music, everything felt complete. The movie wasn't overly romantic and stuck to its central theme. One of the things I loved about the movie is that it featured a strong female lead, which was long overdue especially in tamil cinema.Such nuanced acting and so many complex emotions were beautifully portrayed by the amazing lead. Surya has proved himself yet again as a versatile actor. His eyes carry so much emotion. It was amazing to watch him in his element. I don't think I have ever cried so much while watching a movie. Every obstacle Maara and his gang had faced seemed so personal; I did not feel like a observer watching them from afar, but I felt like I was there with them, sharing their emotions. Surya definitely deserves a national award for this movie in my opinion.The fact that this amazing movie was based on the story/life events of a real-life hero is even more amazing. We don't realise that we take things for granted and forget the hard work and sacrifice of some unsung heroes that went behind the things we enjoy today. This movie has opened my mind to a whole new perspective, and I would definitely think about Captain Gopinath's resolve the next time I get to travel on a plane.

It's refreshing to see it in comparison to Hindi film industry and OTT platforms where women empowerment is reduced to drinking and having sex.Also the father son strained relation also is brought out really well.Even the most hardened person also is bound to shed tears couple of times in the movie.Overall a must watch

The movie is inspirational & dramatic take loosely based on Capt.gopinaths Simply fly.Overall the entire movie is well made with interesting & sometimes over dramatic scenes which we have been fed with in large doses all along in the normal tamil movies.
The movie however is surprisingly very interesting & keeps the audience captive lamost throughout.Really commendable performances by Suriya ,with great emotional depth ,something which has really stood out from the regular run of the mill commercial pot boilers or so called mass entertainers.Kudos suriya.
Another really fun and entertaining act was of course Aparna balamurali who has proved it Does not take stunning looks to hold the audience captive .Her acting as the ever loving ,strong headed ,village girl with bigger dreams are a treat to watch and an act equalling or superior to suriya.Hope i don't sound biased.!!!.

His hard work s brilliantly showed on the screen,Aparna Balamurali shines like a star in the film throughout. This movie is a must watch with a very deep message on never to stop aiming high..! A complete pack and the team has given their best with no places to complain.

reviews.review_title: Crass versus the Class of Capt. Gopinath spoils
reviews.content:
A great theme modelled on the inspirational life of Capt. Gopinath who was a very suave and genteel man.
While it is perfectly acceptable to take creative liberties in a movie like this, there is a limit to it to avoid portraying the hero as a polar opposite of the real person.
Some examples:
* Having the lead character dance at a funeral
* Openly speaking obscenities
* Barging into the room of the President of India to fight his case
* Smooching his wife in public
It is these parts that spoil otherwise great performances by Spirits and some of the lead cast.

reviews.review_title: A not very in detail review of Soorarai Pottru
reviews.content: Soorarai Pottru is a good watch that you should definitely see , there are amazing performances from Surya and Aparna Balamurali whose characters Nedumaaran 'Maara' Rajangam and Bommi have an extremely logical and real relationship.Paresh Rawal plays the villain and i found this to be miscast in some regards because while his expressions are good , he is very obviously being dubbed over and it is sometimes a little jarring.It is a dramatized biopic of Capt. Gopinath who founded Deccan Airlines , it is possibly the best biopic of sorts in Indian Cinema save Paan Singh Tomar, also while im no expert i wanted to note that Niketh Bommireddy the cinematographer is amazing here , also one added detail that i liked was that there was a dialect they used for Surya's character which was Madurai Specific the songs are average but you can skip most since they dont have an effect on the actual movie one the two friends played by KrishnaKumar was very impressively acted. The movie in some parts is obviously dramatized but is still impressive overall I'd give it a 7.8 or 8. Aparna Balamurali who usually plays a side is given a important role and i couldn't tell this was her first big role because of how amazing it was,it is extremely cheeky, they have a guy named Ajay Balaiyya who is very obviously a parody of Vijay Mallya, the villain named Paresh something is a clear parody of Jet Airways Founder Naresh Goel
Suriya deserves National award for his performance 🔥😎👌

Suriya is an eagle among actors but with weak scripts in the recent past, he was unable to fly high in the last few years. Thanks to Sudha Kongara, who has finally served a sumptuous meal to his fans.

Nedumaaran rajaangam has created a huge success besides lots of failure. Director Sudha kongara's masterpiece, GV prakash's Magical Songs & Bgms, Aparna balasubramani, Oorvasi, paresh, and all the characters are nailed their character in this film.

The plot of the movie is absolutely senseless. The idea presented by the protagonist has no connection with reality. According to the movie, he is supposed to be the first guy who thought of saving cost by not providing meals or news papers. Also, his idea of procuring cheap planes again makes no sense. Nobody ever blamed the maker of the planes for twin tower attack. Which VC says that you put in the money first and then we'll reimburse? That too for a paltry sum of 47 Lakhs? I wouldn't recommend using your brain while watching this film. The film is also full of outdated "heroism/heropanti" like the scene where he met the president or stormed into Paresh's office yelling. The love story was the only good part. Things do get better in the second half though.
It's really a awesome journey the movie really motivates the entrepreneurs must watch film.

Special mention is the Airport scene, definitely gives a hard hitting emotion .This movie shows us no matter how many obstacles we face, we have to stand by our guts, confidence and the values we believe in then definitely success will be on our side.DOP has done a very good job. It gives us vintage 90's vibe. Music is another plus for the movie. All the songs are amazing and are well made.Must watch film.

Soorarai Pottru is the best and great film I've watched. Really amazing storyline. This film is based on a true story of Capt. Gopinath's life. This film is a journey and please don't hesitate to watch this film. You won't regret. Great job done by all Soorarai Pottru team. Easily brings in the emotional attachment from the very beginning, gets us highly invested and feel for the characters. Tears and goosebumps guaranteed in this film.Coming to the performances, Suriya look outstanding in each and every frame. For me, this has to be one of the best performances I have seen after a long time. Actor Suriya has literally lived the character 'Nedumaaran' and in most of the scenes his eyes talk a lot. Don't miss it guys. His performance will leave a huge impact, especially the scene where he needs to fly home to see his sick father. I literally cried out watching that scene. Really heart breaking scene. It reminds me of Suriya's acting in Vaaranam Ayiram when his girlfriend dead. OMG. To be honest his acting skill is more better in Soorarai Pottru. That is wat Suriya is. He always make him better every time. That hardwork and dedication really paid off in this film. Feel really really happy for Suriya.Not forgetting the female lead Aparna, did play a very good role in Suriya's life in the film. One of a memorable character done by and projected really well. Your this character really create impact in every boy's life to get this kind of girl in their life as well. Also in girl's heart to have that caring and understanding feeling in them. Your chemistry with Suriya is incomparable. Another memorable character would be Suriya's mother in this film, Urvashi. She also played very well and bring tears in almost every scene she's in. So touching.All the supporting casts are apt for their role and given their best. Special mentions for Karunas and Mohan Babu. I'm not lying this is the most best Tamil movie I've watched more than 3 times. The feeling that I have when I watched for the first time is still there even I watched it again and again. Suriya's acting is the highlight of Soorarai Pottru. He just nailed it. I loved the storyline so much. Huge applause to Sudha Kongara for this master piece. Hats off to Suriya, Aparna, Urvashi, Karunas, Mohan Babu and all the other cast in the film. Superb performance performed by all of you. Music and bgm given by GV Prakash is superb and it definitely gives more value for the movie.Cinematography and editing is handled well.Soorarai Pottru is a movie that stays really close to our heart and is a big-time inspiration also motivation to all those who believe in themselves to work hard and to never forget their roots. Don't miss this one. . Suriya really proved the word "no pain no gain". Behind every success there is hundreds of sacrifices. Just stay strong and believe in yourself. Your mind is like a magnet, if u think bad u attract negativities and if u think good then you are attracting positivity.Again big round of applause to all Soorarai Pottru team. Really happy to watch this master piece of Suriya. This film is a huge come back for Suriya Anna after so long. Many people may think after watching this film that Suriya is back but only Suriya's fans know that Suriya is always there but only you guys didn't noticed him. This movie is really a proud moment for all Suriya fans and for all Indians also film industry.Guys go for it..You will not regret the time invested in this film. Definitely you will love it. Best OTT released. Perfect inspirational.

After 7th Sense, I was expecting a director that completely utilize the potential of Surya but even Selvaraghavan wasn't enough to break the jinx. Sudha had the real intent to make a movie that drives on the characters and not on the star cast. The way she cleared off the baggage of some mannerisms of Surya from him previous movie is indeed the best part. Surya now looked like a "Bala" student and he was only maara and not Surya. Aparna was so natural and she can easily play any rural subjects but not limited to that though. I never liked to see Urvashi cry but this time I cried with her too for her breathtaking performance. GV prakash is in his own league and nothing short of perfection. Che, Seba, Alapparrai, Kaali and All the other characters outperformed too and they will carry that Soorarai Potru tag with their name from now on.

.The above statement may seem exaggerated, but the film is structured like a flight. We hear the engine sound in the title card and the swift departure takes away our breath. We are introduced to Sundari played by Aparna Balamurali on a train to meet Nedumaaran Rajangam. The character seemed to be a rebel in the beginning, but later we find him to be a calm person who bursts off when suppressed downright. The characters are given to actors who know their job very well. Urvasi, Aparna, Maaran's friends deliver a great performance on screen. Paresh Rawal, Achyut Kumar delivers an antagonist role very well. Special mention is needed for 'Poo' Ram who plays Maaran's father. Karunas gives some pleasant jokes in the film. Meanwhile, Nedumaaran Rajangam played by Suriya will stay in the hearts for a long haul. This will stay as one of Suriya's career-best performance among Nandha and Pitamagan. Sudha Kongara's screenplay and direction, steer the film. One can argue that she alone holds the complete film on her shoulders. GV Prakash Kumar's music is highly enjoyable and sticks to the mood. The cinematography and the overall color tone are just splendid. I personally wished the climactic sequences were a bit more lengthy since it would have helped get Sudha Kongara her a standing ovation like how she got in Iruthisuttru. Well, that need not be considered as a flaw but I felt the film ended soon. Overall Soorarai Pottru is the one such film that never makes you take your eye off the screen. It makes your eyes wet at times but the journey or I might say flight is smooth and enjoyable.Even though it has predictable scenes the screenplay makes us yearn to know what happens next. That's where the magic happens.
Inspiring, emotional and brilliant screenplay. I suggest everyone to watch the movie.

reviews.review_title: The Suriya who I loved the most is back with Inspiring Biopic
reviews.content: I have to wait 12 years for a inspiring film from Suriya after Vaaranam aayiram. I have to Thank Sudha kongara mam for that. I saw only Maara not Suriya and he lived as Maara. I can't remember when was the last the time I cried for a movie. In Soorarai pottru, whenever Maara cries you can't control your tears. Aparna balamurali as Bommi, bold supporting wife, every Man with a dream longing for. Chemistry between them is so natural and beautiful. Nikketh and G.V as pillars for the movie. Art work at its best and can't imagine how they recreate and created the world of Maara. This movie definitely motivates person who wants to be entrepreneur. Eventually, for Two things I respect this movie : 1) Suriya - dreams as Maara, Struggled as Maara and won as Maara 2) Mutual respect between Maara and Bommi and their passion towards their dreams.

I am positive that no person other than Suriya could do justice to the role and movie. Aparna Balamurali has also played a wonderful role and she doesn't miss a chance to grab our attention.
